1.Pros: It is a good job to learn how to deal with a fast paced environment as well as work well with others as a team to back each other up.
1.Cons: At the very least the mcdonalds I worked at had poor management which made the job much harder than it needed to be.

2.Pros: - Gain experience- Customers & majority of the staff made you feel at home- Free fountain drinks & coffee on the clock- Discount on lunch break
2.Cons: - Lack of training. Be expected to be thrown out there and not taught how to do anything, but coworkers will still get frustrated at you for not knowing how to do something.- Will make you question how some people got promoted to management positions.- Big con for me was that the management did not care about the customers; orders CONSTANTLY wrong and busted restrooms for instance.- Understaffed during peak hours and overstaffed at night

3.Pros: Flexible scheduling, get along with coworkers and bosses free meal

4.Cons: Terrible pay (even as a manager), poor environment, poor conditions, lazy coworkers.

5.Pros: Flexible hours, professional and caring management
